fields.description:
The 'tags' tab at the top of the page is not clickable, but when you hover over it all tags are shown in a menu. Click on them to view the source as of that tag.

How about also making 'Tags' a link to a tags page? It would show all tags, including 'tip', in a list down the page, and for each one would be output similar the the built-in 'churn' extension. Except that instead of ascii text, use google charts (or whatever).

The idea is it would give some clue as to the amount of work, and who did it, for each release. And with the tip tag included, it would give a strong hint whether you should use a released tarball or whether a lot of work has been done that has not yet been released.

Another visualization might be to at the top of the page, show all tags on a horizontal graph spaced according to time, with the height showing amount of churn between each tag.
fields.summary: Have a 'tags' page, show diffstats via churn

fields.description:
Line breaks are being ignored when viewing the changelog.

Here's an example:

http://www.bitbucket.org/naviserver/naviserver/history/nsd/tclinit.c

The actual changelog message contains a title, a blank line, and then a description. Some of the descriptions are formatted with line breaks, but not paragraphs (like a traditional ChangeLog message).

I would like to see HTML 'p' tags used when a blank like is present, and HTML 'br' tags at the end of line, if there is a newline before, say 80 characters.

If you could autodetect usage like:

* dir/file.c: frobbed the whatsit

and format with 'pre', that would be great.
fields.summary: text to html formatting error when viewing changelog

fields.description: I usually copy changeset numbers from the console; and Hg displays them as "rev:hash", so it would be nice if the dialog box to insert changeset links into issue comments cut the "rev:" part away.
fields.summary: Accept rev:hash notation in issue comment "link to changeset" feature

fields.description:
I create a new private repo. However, when I go to admin the repo, wiki and issues appear public.

I suspect most people expect private repos used for development to be private, including issues / wiki.

Security should be declarative. So I'd lean towards making the wiki private if repo is private, but still allow developer to make it public if needed.
fields.summary: Private Repo != private wiki / issues

fields.description: example: http://www.bitbucket.org/bboissin/test/overview/
fields.summary: Commit message isn't escaped in overview

fields.description:
It looks like Bb detects when my source has a README file and displays the contents automatically.  Nice!

Can the feature be extended to detect similarly-named files (e.g., README.txt, or even README.md like github allows)?

On a similar note, would it be possible to let the "syntax highlighting" for some text formats (e.g., Markdown) be an HTML rendering?  That would enable rich documentation alla Reg Braithwaite's homoiconic project.
fields.summary: Enhanced README and text markup

fields.description:
Hello,

SIgned up using OpenID, the couldn't push so I've requested a new password.

However the new password do not work.

Please advice.

User: tebeka

Thanks,\\
Miki
fields.summary: Reset password don't work

fields.description:
can this project be enhanced to work with other laconica servers ?\\
thanks
fields.summary: other laconica servers

fields.description:
A couple of requests:

Private repositories should have the ability to show the commit messages without exposing diffs and files, allowing people to follow development.

In addition, if a private repository has any public components (such as the issue tracker for bitbucket), the project should be listed, and going to e.g. /jespern/bitbucket should not give the "project is private" message, rather it should just show all public tabs and default to the first one.
fields.summary: Private repository features

fields.description: I'd really appreciate it if you didn't require I have content for bugs, either when filing against others, or when having them filed against me. "Titles don't display properly in Cantonese" is a fine description in itself; I don't see a reason to force my user to enter something in content.
fields.summary: Don't *require* me to have content in bugs

fields.description: A nice to have would be to be able to commit against a branch that has the same name as an issue id, and get link backs in the same way that when you put #n in the commit comment you get a linkback. That way you could have a workflow by which you create a bug, all work is done on a branch and all commits would link via the UI to the bug.
fields.summary: Branch per bug

fields.description:
In the wiki for my repo the wiki markup looks like this

<<issue 1>>

and issue BCLOUD-1 does exist, but no link gets rendered, rather just:

BCLOUD-1

as plain text.
fields.summary: Linking to an issue does not render properly

fields.description: You don't seem to be able to delete a repository if you have authenticated yourself with OpenId, because the form for deletion expects you to enter your password.
fields.summary: Cannot delete repo if authenticated with OpenId

fields.description:
The issue view currently offers four buttons: All, Mine, Create new, Query.\\
The issue menu has these entries: New, Open, Closed, Mine, All, Create new.

I think that some improvements to usability can be made:

* For the buttons (which I gather present shortcuts to most important commands): I'd argue that Open would be more helpful than All.
* For the menu: why is Query not in it?
fields.summary: Minor improvements to Issue commands

fields.description:
There should be some way to delete messages in the inbox.

(Or, if they are to expire automatically, some way to configure that.)
fields.summary: Delete messages

fields.description: Since I get incoming messages as e-mails, I usually don't read them one by one via the web interface. It would therefore be nice to be able to set them all to read at once.
fields.summary: Add a way to mark all incoming messages as read

fields.description: E.g. in http://www.bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/changeset/d51d271ecadf/, the changeset hash and revno (d51d271ecadf and 739, respectively) don't show up. It would be nice to have them somewhere on the page, not only in the URL.
fields.summary: Put changeset name on changeset detail page

fields.description:
The repo admin should be able to select whether he want weekly, monthly, or nothing at all (default) summary emails.

These should contain information on how many issues are in various states on various milestones, and what activity there has been in that time period.

Ideas:

* Open issues breakdown (total + new)
* Opened and re-opened issues
* Closed issues
* Top issues most discussed

Yes, I'm blatantly ripping off the python-dev summary emails. But they're nice.

Anyone feel free to add more ideas.
fields.summary: Option to send out monthly/weekly issue mails (BB-324)

fields.description:
have HP dv1600 and Webcam 1000. ./loader gives me the below error:

l:~/r5u87x$ ./loader\\
Searching for device...

Error: Failed to find any supported webcams

lsusb out is:

Bus 005 Device 002: ID 05ca:1870 Ricoh Co., Ltd Webcam 1000

My web cam is listed in the model-matrix.txt file but it says not supported by loader. Is there any other way to load the firmware?

h2. Extract from supported model file.
0x05CA 0x1870 R5U870 WDM HP Pavilion Webcam / HP Webcam 1000 VID/PID combination used by two distinct devices. dv1xxx appears to be\\
the less common of the two. The only way to check the difference is to\\
read the model number out via DMI. Not currently supported by loader.
fields.summary: HP dv 1000 web cam loader does not work

fields.description: I think that where currently we can only see "Clone URL / Push URL : https://user@bitbucket.org/user/repo/" there should also be the SSH url to the repository.
fields.summary: Show SSH URL of repo
typo in cacfcb2cd0e2

fields.description: Look into this.
fields.summary: Seems parenthesis are not allowed in issue titles

fields.description: The delta does not make sense here. I think I can remove the delta entirely from Oberon as it's called {{{size}}}, which doesn't reflect what it is. Maybe keep in {{{delta}}}, but I don't think there's a need to.
fields.summary: Should not email delta size, but bytes removed plus bytes added in total (BB-521)

fields.description: if there is something thats know unfixable i don't want to mark it as invalid, cause it might be valid, just not fixable
fields.summary: resolve bugs as wontfix

fields.description: It'd be very cool if I could see filtered history for a particular branch (à la {{hg log -b thebranch}}). This would allow me to filter out changes introduced by merging with upstream.
fields.summary: Filtered history for branches (BB-520)

fields.description: Title says it all :)
fields.summary: Commit email signature separator should be "-- ", not "--".

fields.description: It would be nice to see the number of bugs in a query somewhere on the issue list page.
fields.summary: Show number of bugs in query (BB-519)

fields.description:
Hi !

First thank you for allowing us to host our free projects there.

I think it could be better that the projects feeds were ordered by date desc.

Thank you !
fields.summary: Repository feeds are backwards/in the wrong order (BB-47)

fields.description:
see

http://www.selenic.com/mercurial/wiki/index.cgi/ActivityExtension and / or\\
http://www.bitbucket.org/Ry4an/hg-chart-extension/wiki/

Keep up the good work\\
Bastian
fields.summary: Visualize repository activity by using hg activity

fields.description: I created my account using OpenID. When I tried to change my  generated password I got error "old password is wrong". Then I used reset password feature twice and each time when I tried to change the generated password I got the same error...
fields.summary: reset password doesn't work

fields.description: That would be nice if you allow dots in username... And don't say your platform doesn't do it :)
fields.summary: dots in usernames (BB-517)

fields.description:
I think I've found a little bug. Here are the steps to reproduce it:

* Go to "Repositories" and click on the last page of results.
* Make a search that yields less pages (I've tried "python")
* Bug! The search view tries to go to an inexsistent page because it includes the page number in the url.
* Also the error page comes with no style, probably due to a url issue.
fields.summary: Error in pagination when searching

fields.description: Switch to using extensions instead, maybe? Not sure, gotta find a nice solution.
fields.summary: Format detection of READMEs flaky

fields.description:
http://perso.ens-lyon.fr/benoit.boissinot/avatar-bb.png

Thanks, tonfa.
fields.summary: Avatars are bordered in FF 3.0.3

fields.description:
Mercurial currently does that and it's quite useful.\\
For example for us it makes the code in 'mercurial' appear before the code in 'tests' or the changes in 'test-foo' appear before the changes in 'test-foo.out'.
fields.summary: diff should display the files in alphabetical order

fields.description: The same changeset is display in the newsfeed multiple times if you follow multipe repositories on which the given changeset appears.
fields.summary: Same changeset displayed multiple times in newsfeed

both hg ssh:// and hg http://  do not allow write access.\\
hg ssh:// doesn't allow read access.

I use login/passwd, or openid to access the webinterface.
fields.summary: can not use ssh (keys uploaded) nor login with hg

fields.description: I'm not receiving email updates on issues I'm following.
fields.summary: Issue update emails not sent

fields.description: See e.g. http://www.bitbucket.org/jespern/bitbucket/wiki/API
fields.summary: Wiki sublists must indent

fields.description:
Hello,

would be possilbe add syntax highlighting for language like F#?

I wanna start project here and I would welcome it.

More color profiles would be welcome also, because current are barely to see.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for F#

fields.description: Currently just says "user mq oldrepo"
fields.summary: mq event needs proper text/link to repo (BB-47)

fields.description: I forked my project fn to rearrange the layout and separate specific apps into their own repositories, and now it has been stuck at cloning for 12 hours.
fields.summary: Project fork is stuck at cloning

fields.description:
Forking a project (through the "Fork" hyperlink at the top of a project page) and then naming your forked project the same thing as the original project throws a generic "oops!" style error page.

It would be nice to have an error message that described why the new project could not be created, since there is a simple, direct cause for the error.
fields.summary: Forking with Same Name gives Generic Error

fields.description: Doesn't make sense in anything closed, e.g. resolved, duplicate, etc.
fields.summary: Don't show Bump button for some states (BB-516)

fields.description: Using the Bump-button should generate emails too.
fields.summary: Bumping an issue doesn't send an email to followers/responsible

fields.description: See subject.
fields.summary: Only check for spam if comment is set

fields.description:
I think that follow/unfollow notifications for repositories that I do not own, shouldn't be displayed in my private newsfeed.

Also, follow/unfollow action should be stored once - I recently saw that in my nf:

http://img.skitch.com/20081023-jubinsxnyg2wsbebwf9wrk3eih.jpg
fields.summary: Repository followers (BB-47)

fields.description:
Would it be possible to provide a broker for lighthouse app ( http://lighthouseapp.com/ ) issue/milestone tracking application for Bitbucket, or do I have to write one on my own?

Even if I do write one, I'd have to host it etc. Too many hoops to run through, wondering if you have a certified one already ?
fields.summary: Open source the BB brokers (BB-1695)

fields.description: The mercurial folks request this.

fields.description: On top, always!

add a user macro for linking to users

fields.description:
From inside the message view, the wrong avatar and user dropdown is displayed.

It appears to re-use the avatar and the dropdown from the user of the first notification.

http://alexhixon.com/t/message-avatar-bug.png
fields.summary: Notifications view displays wrong avatar

fields.description: The source-view should also use the indent setting, if possible.
fields.summary: Indent setting not adhered to in source-view (BB-515)

fields.description:
Lists and tables look like hell, e.g.

Here's an example: http://www.bitbucket.org/david/djangofr/wiki/OldNewDocTable

User requests zebra-rows.

fields.description:
So you can see who forked it, but deeper.

{{{\\
bitbucket

* bitbucket-foo-feature
* bitbucket-bar-feature\\
-bitbucket-gnarly-feature
* bitbucket-quux-feature\\
}}}
fields.summary: Transitive fork trees (BB-336)

fields.description: For at least the past week, there has been some kind of bug in the changeset view that causes tabs to be expanded to four spaces. This really messes up source code that uses tabs for alignment with the expectation that they are (by popular convention) eight spaces wide. Suggestion: don't convert tabs to either four/eight spaces, like in the source view.
fields.summary: Tabs converted to spaces in changeset view

fields.description:
I've send several replies to my team member's queries in my notificaions inbox, but I never see my replies in the message thread or in the sent folder.

I just sent one about 5 min ago to user 'skypher', and another one yesterday.  I'm not sure the message went through at all, so I have to rely on a private email converstation (which is not always possible, since I may not know always know the email address).

Please look into this.

Thanks

Yarek
fields.summary: Replies to messages in my inbox are not visible to me.

fields.description: I followed the "using ssh" tutorial and got stuck at pulling anything from bitbucket. It fails with  "Permission denied (publickey,password).".
fields.summary: ssh pull and push fails with Permission denied (publickey,password).

fields.description: it's possible to create many forks of one allowed private repository and use them as different repositories.
fields.summary: fork of private repository for free accounts

fields.description:
I created a patch queue and had some trouble cloning it (I was using the wrong protocol, but didn't know that at the time).  So I tried deleting and re-creating the patch queue.

The creation screen hung (and is still hung, five hours later), though I can go into the admin URL for the new queue in a new browser tab.  I've tried deleting the new repo from the admin screen, but I just get internal server errors.

Can you delete the repo for me?  The repo in question is a private one ending in "-patches" (plural; the similar one with a singular name works fine).

Thanks.
fields.summary: Hung patch queue creation; stuck empty repo

fields.description: Otherwise they show too fast, which is annoying.
fields.summary: Put hoverintent on tooltips for issues etc.

fields.description:
For example, funky-rubber-u is not cool, should cut off at 'funky-rubber'.

Applies to issues and repositories.
fields.summary: Overhaul to_slug so the slugs are not ugly

fields.description: That way we can still obtain an avatar, based on the email address.
fields.summary: Avatar: When the user is not a registered user with Bitbucket, fallback to Gravatar

fields.description: I recently committed a changeset to my repository (http://www.bitbucket.org/IndigoJo/qtm/overview/ ) which included a "pre" tag (as in "Implemented proper handling of [pre] in the doPreview slot") in the commit message, but when I looked at my repo overview afterwards, I discovered that Bitbucket had not encoded the tag when displaying the changeset heading, resulting in an actual preformatted text block appearing.  It should display the tag literally as it was part of the changeset log.
fields.summary: Encode greater/less symbols in changeset displays

fields.description:
h1. Make sure you have multiple pages worth of "Mine" issues
h1. Click the "Mine" button to see your issues
h1. Click one of the page numbers
h1. Observe that the query was lost

When I'm not logged into bitbucket.org the clone url for anonymous user have a form of\\
https://bitbucket.org/szczepiq/mockito-python/\\
which prevents to clone the repo with a error message: HTTP 403 forbidden

The clone url for anonymous user should have http:// instead of https://
fields.summary: Clone repository url for anonymous user should not contain https

fields.description: dutfnaqm http://xjeajzgk.com fkcbqhtg iyuoakoh [URL=http://arvtceyu.com]otilrtsp[/URL] aoqahdbi
fields.summary: jfdtwjts

fields.description:
My browser (Firefox 3.0.3) usually has scripts disabled (I'm using the NoScripts extension), but this causes the text "Repositories" and "Accounts" in the top right corner of all pages to be overlayed

The problem disappears when scripts are enabled.
fields.summary: Browser artifacts if scripts disabled

fields.description:
Show statistics about most used projects programming languages.\\
(Analogue to http://github.com/languages)
fields.summary: Show Used Language Statistics/Graph (BB-514)

fields.description:
Move the searchform to the startpage instead of having to navigate through the Repositories page.\\
(Analogue to Github)
fields.summary: Move Search Repositories To Startpage

fields.description: Add the ability to make an individual issue private in an otherwise public tracker for e.g. security bugs.
fields.summary: per-issue privacy (BB-513)

fields.description:
h1. Go to "Mine" issues
h1. Click a state of one of the issues to filter it by state
h1. Click "Edit query"
h1. Make no changes and just hit "Update query"
h1. Note that the "Mine" restriction on the query was lost
fields.summary: "edit query" lossage

fields.description:
When I create a patch queue for an existing repository, there are two places where Bb offers the option to apply a patch: one on the Patch Series tab, and one on the Source tab (next to the patch name).

The former reports "patched" after I click on it, but appears to do nothing else.  The latter reports an exception.  Neither one actually applies the patch to the original repository (I may be misunderstanding the intent of this feature, so the solution to this ticket may just involve some docs).  In both cases, the next time I visit the controls, the option to patch is still there.
fields.summary: Applying patches reports success, but does nothing (BB-205)

fields.description: The Issue Tracker Administration page has fields with titles such as "Issue default assignee". To be grammatical, these should be "Default issue assignee", etc. Or you could just remove "issue" from the titles.
fields.summary: Issue Tracker Administration grammar

fields.description: The page where you can upload your avatar should have some text explaining the desired size and what'll happen if your image isn't that size (just like the Project logo upload on the Admin page does).
fields.summary: Give avatar upload details

fields.description:
The fork event now only shows the fork, but if the original repo is also made available to the templates we could show original too.

"user created new-repo, a fork of original-repo"
fields.summary: Newsfeed should show which repo was forked

fields.description:
In the newsfeed, we link to issues referenced in commit messages, and show info in tooltip.

The tooltip should not show any info if issues are private.
fields.summary: [privacy] Showing info about issue in tooltip even if issues are private (BB-512)

fields.description: It'd be nice if there was an option somewhere not to get notification emails about your own comments/changes to issues.
fields.summary: option not to be notified about own comments (BB-511)

fields.description:
So that the features added by BCLOUD-222 are discoverable to users. The way the octothorpe is interpreted should also be included.

Please correct if I misassigned this.
fields.summary: document and/or add buttons for macros

fields.description: The forked repo can't be found in the repo search, and the forked project UI becomes non-functional. see ruby-fedora et. al
fields.summary: deleting parent of parent of fork makes bad things happen

fields.description:
Functionality broken when accessed from page other than first, e.g.:\\
http://www.bitbucket.org/repo/all/7/?name=python
fields.summary: Repository search broken

fields.description: Subject says it all...
fields.summary: Wiki can be chosen as landing page (and accessed) even if not enabled in repository admin (BB-510)

fields.description:
If you create a fork of a repo, the admin settings are all correct in the fork-form.

The same does not apply for all fields when you create a patch queue.

To reproduce:

# Set wiki and issues private for a repo.
# Click "fork" on that repo. Notice that the checkboxes for wiki and issues private are checked.
# Click "patch queue" for the same repo. Notice that the checkboxes for wiki and issues private are not checked.
fields.summary: Creating patch queue doesn't copy all settings for original repo

fields.description: It is usual in web interfaces for DVCS's that the first line in any commit message is shown in the web interface, so that the developer can give a brief summary and then a detailed message later.  This is the case in the normal "grey/white" hg web interface, as it is in Github and Gitorious.  In Bitbucket, however, the other lines are just tacked onto the end, even if there are two newlines between them, as there always are in my commit messages.  This should be corrected.
fields.summary: Use first line of commit message in commit list (BB-2182)

fields.description:
Format looks simple, yet undocumented. Would be cool to let people download an export of their tree in codeswarm XML format, and render it locally.

http://code.google.com/p/codeswarm/
fields.summary: For fun: Export functionality for codeswarm

fields.description:
hi! would you mind adding highlighting support for the clojure language to wikis and the code browser, as time permits? pygments already has it (see http://pygments.org/docs/lexers/#lexers-for-agile-languages)

thanks a lot!
fields.summary: syntax highlighting for clojure files

fields.description:
If you're viewing/editing an issue, and someone saves a change to that issue, you should be notified and asked if you want to update the issue.

If you choose to update the issue, we should probably at least retain the contents of the comment field on the reload.
fields.summary: Display update warning on issues

fields.description: Your wiki does not render cyrilic symbols. If on the page present cyrilic ("привет", for example), the page is blank.
fields.summary: Russian letters.

fields.description: Lets discuss this at the meeting tonight.
fields.summary: Grouping repositories / project groups (BB-53)

fields.description: Hi, adding my openid account (darkrho.myopenid.com) into openid setting page (http://www.bitbucket.org/account/openid/) doesn't do anything, just reload the page.
fields.summary: OpenID association

fields.description:
When I push to my patch repository I get the following output:

{{{\\
#!shell\\
% mq push\\
pushing to https://mg:***@bitbucket.org/mg/hg-i18n-patches/.hg/patches\\
searching for changes\\
Exception: DoesNotExist('Repository matching query does not exist.',)\\
Exception: DoesNotExist('Repository matching query does not exist.',)\\
Exception: DoesNotExist('Repository matching query does not exist.',)\\
Exception: DoesNotExist('Repository matching query does not exist.',)\\
}}}

Here "mq" is a shell alias for "hg -R $(hg root)/.hg/patches".

The funny thing is that everything seems to work despite the error messages. That is also why I haven't reported it earlier.
fields.summary: Harmless(?) exception when pushing to MQ repository

fields.description: I notice that the default font for displaying repositories is a Courier-type font.  I am using Firefox 3 on Ubuntu Hardy and find that this font does not display all that well; it looks squashed and unclear (as Freetype isn't that good at rendering small serif fonts, even with bytecode interpreting switched on).  I recommend specifying a standard Linux sans-serif mono font in the CSS such as DejaVu or Vera Sans Mono first, then going to other fonts which will display if DejaVu or Vera is not available.  BTW, the standard Hg web interface uses a sans font, as do Launchpad, GitHub and Gitorious.
fields.summary: Use sans-serif font in repo displays

fields.description: Otherwise people can just make infinite private repos.
fields.summary: Disable the "private" checkbox for existing repositories, if limit is reached

fields.description:
It would be nice if an existing repo could later become a fork of another project after the fact. For instance, tksoh just moved his TortoiseHg repos to bitbucket and now I would like to make my thg-hg-crew-tip repo a fork of this (albeit at a given rev).

I know I could just kill and recreate the repo, but that would throw followers off, wouldn't it?

http://www.bitbucket.org/tksoh/tortoisehg-crew/overview/

http://www.bitbucket.org/parren/thg-hg-crew-tip/overview/
fields.summary: Allow existing repo to become a fork (BB-509)

fields.description: XSS. Thanks, Peng.
fields.summary: Serve raw files as attachments

fields.description:
See comment BCLOUD-2 on http://www.bitbucket.org/jespern/bitbucket/issue/180/

The message is "Changed kind from proposal to enhancement" while the actual field is called type, not kind.
fields.summary: kind/type inconsistency

fields.description:
The user homepage (i.e. with title "username / home - bitbucket.org") lists your repos, but doesn't indicate which ones are private.

It'd be nice if it did (e.g. lock icons, or separate sections, or whatever).
fields.summary: user homepage should indicate privacy of repos

fields.description: The bitbucket homepage should probably link to mercurial's website somewhere (e.g. hyperlink one of the mentions of "Mercurial").
fields.summary: homepage should link to mercurial's website

fields.description: The docs should probably contain a link to the excellent mercurial book -- http://hgbook.red-bean.com/hgbook.html , especially since BB is probably some people's entry point into mercurial.
fields.summary: link to hgbook in docs
